```{r}
#Adding fonts for plots and axis 
my_theme <- function() {
  theme_classic() +                        
    theme(
      plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5, vjust = 1, size = 40, color = "#FFCE00", family = "PT Sans Pro Narrow"),
      plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust=0.5, vjust = 1, size = 20, family = "PT Sans Pro Narrow", color = 'white'),
      plot.background = element_rect(fill = "black"),
      axis.text.x = element_text(vjust=0.1, hjust = 0.1 , size=15, color = "white"),
      axis.text.y = element_blank(),
      axis.title.x = element_text(family = "Roboto", size=18, color = "white"),
      axis.title.y = element_blank(),
      panel.background = element_rect(fill= "black" , color = "black")
    )
}



# Join data 
data <- left_join(episodes, seasons, by = "season")

# Calculate counts
data <- data %>%
  group_by(season) %>%
  summarise(finished = sum(finished), 
            tapped_out = n() - sum(finished))  

# Calculate totals
data <- data %>% 
  mutate(total = finished + tapped_out)
  
# Calculate percentages
data <- data %>%
  mutate(finished_pct = finished/total * 100) 


# Round percentages  
data <- data %>%
  mutate(labels = percent(finished_pct, accuracy = 0.01))





# Plot stacked bar chart
ggplot(data, aes(x=season, y=finished, fill="Finished")) +
  geom_bar(stat='identity', width = 0.8, position=position_dodge(0.5)) + 
  geom_bar(aes(y = tapped_out, fill = "Tapped Out"), stat='identity', width = 0.8,position=position_dodge(0.5)) +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(finished_pct, 2),'%')), vjust = -0.5, size= 5.5 , color = "white") +
  scale_fill_manual(values=c("#FFCE00","#E4342E")) + my_theme()+
  labs( title = "GUEST PERFORMANCE TRENDS ON HOT ONES BY SEASON",
        subtitle =    htmltools::HTML(paste0(
        "Hot Ones is a popular YouTube show where celebrities answer questions while eating increasingly spicy wings. ",
        " The fill colors represent two categories: <span style='color:blue;'>FINISHED</span> and <span style='color:red;'>Tapped Out</span>"), x = "Season") ) + guides(fill = 'none') 

```
